metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12399 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
NSS has shown timing differences when performing DSA signatures, which wasexploitable and could eventually leak private keys. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 68.9.0, Firefox < 77, and Firefox ESR < 68.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12399` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.1
libnss3-tools - 2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nss package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.49.1-1ubuntu1.1').
firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
